Rust

A Programming Language focused on performance, reliability, productivity, and carcinization

Manage Rust Versions with Rustup #process

Rustup is a version manager for Rust, similar to plenv or pyenv. Since Rust updates happen every six weeks, this is helpful.

Install on Windows by downloading rustup-init.exe

Everyone else can use the shell script installer

curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh

Update toolchain via Rustup

rustup update stable

Related

rustup.rs - The Rust toolchain installer

Manage Rust Projects with Cargo #process

Cargo is the Rust manager for projects, packages, and dependencies

cargo new

creates a new project

cargo new hello

Creates Cargo.,toml for project config and a src/ folder for sources

bsh ❯ tree hello/
hello/
├── Cargo.toml
└── src
    └── main.rs

1 directory, 2 files

cargo run from project folder compiles and runs the project

bsh ❯ cargo run
   Compiling hello v0.1.0 (/home/random/Projects/pl-to-rs/01-introduction/hello)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.30s
     Running `target/debug/hello`
Hello, world!
note

cargo new and cargo run are more like the typical Rust workflow
